name: Fumen
tagline: Chord and Rythm score rendering engine
body:
### Welcome to Fumen Pages.
"Fumen" is a chord and rythm score rendering engine which run on the web browsers. Fumen is a pure client-side javascript program. 

### About Fumen
Fumen is a kind of "Markdown" text text processor. Fumen load text data markup with fumen grammer and generate score as SVG image on the web browser. 

### Creating pages manually

#### Markdown
Markdown | Description 
---------|------------
\|       | Border of a measure
\|\|     | Border of a measure(Double border)
\|\|:  :\|\|| Start/End of a loop 
\|\|:x4  | End of a loop with number of loop
\|\|.    | End of a piece
[A]      | Reharsal mark

#### Markdown in the mesure

Markdown | Description
---------|-------------
\<S\>      | Segno
\<D.S.\>   | Dal Segno
\<D.S.2\>  | Dal Segno with number(any number can be specified)
\<D.C.\>   | Da Capo
\<D.C.\>   | 
\<D.C. al Coda\> | Da Capo al Segno
\<Coda\>   | Coda
[1.]     | Loop number
(3/4)    | Time mark
 
#### Variables
Variable | Value | Example | Description
---------|-------|---------|-------------
TITLE    | Any string | %TITLE="Thriller" | Title of a piece
ARTIST   | Any string | %ARTIST="Michael Jackson" | Artist of a piece
TRANSPOSE | Number    | %TRANSPOSE="+2" | Transpose 


### Authors and Contributors
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor’s GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out our [documentation](https://help.github.com/pages) or [contact support](https://github.com/contact) and we’ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
